definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Take the initiative to temper themselves, must cultivate fruit character.
sentences.chinese: 主動鍛鍊自己，培養果決的性格。

sentences.english: And of course nothing can stand in your way as long as you’re taking decisive action.
sentences.chinese: 當然，只要你果決行動，什麼都不能阻攔你。
他的支持者欣賞他的果決。

sentences.english: Cantabile, nearly in the morning cries, simply but decisively.
sentences.chinese: 如歌，近於晨的呼喊，乾脆而又果決。

definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to charge and break through enemy lines
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
